key_points: Democrats in Congress are planning swift impeachment proceedings against President Donald Trump following the Capitol siege.
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi emphasized the need for immediate action against an 'unhinged' president.
Republican Senator Lisa Murkowski and other Republicans have criticized Trump, with Murkowski calling for his resignation.
Trump has promised a smooth transfer of power but will not attend Joe Biden's inauguration, a rare presidential snub.
Pelosi discussed preventing Trump from initiating military hostilities or accessing nuclear launch codes with Gen. Mark Milley.
The draft impeachment articles accuse Trump of abuse of power related to the Capitol siege.
A House vote on impeachment could occur as soon as Wednesday.
White House spokesman Judd Deere criticized the impeachment efforts as divisive.
Twitter has permanently suspended Trump's account, citing 'risk of further incitement of violence'.
Pelosi and Schumer have also considered invoking the 25th Amendment to remove Trump, though this seems unlikely following resignations in the Cabinet.
spokespersons: Gen. Mark Milley (Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff)
